block.p: Meaghan Hundley Dowling, the daughter of Hebe and John L. Dowling of New York, was married yesterday to Michael William Chorske, a son of Gayle and William W. Chorske of Woodstock, Vt. The Rev. Thomas P. Thorne performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Assumption in Westport, Conn.

Mrs. Chorske, 31, is a senior editor at William Morrow, a unit of HarperCollins Publishers in New York. She graduated cum laude from Princeton University and received a master's degree in English from Middlebury College. Her father, who retired as an executive vice president and a director of Cushman & Wakefield, the commercial real estate company in New York, is now a private investor. Her mother is a trustee of the Museum of the City of New York.

Meaghan Hundley Dowling, the daughter of Hebe and John L. Dowling of New York, was married yesterday to Michael William Chorske, a son of Gayle and William W. Chorske of Woodstock, Vt. The Rev. Thomas P. Thorne performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Assumption in Westport, Conn.

Mrs. Chorske, 31, is a senior editor at William Morrow, a unit of HarperCollins Publishers in New York. She graduated cum laude from Princeton University and received a master's degree in English from Middlebury College. Her father, who retired as an executive vice president and a director of Cushman & Wakefield, the commercial real estate company in New York, is now a private investor. Her mother is a trustee of the Museum of the City of New York.

Mr. Chorske, 32, is a senior director for corporate development, in Santa Clara, Calif., for InterTrust Technologies, a provider of digital technology that protects content. He graduated from Middlebury and received an M.B.A. degree from Columbia University. His father retired as the president, in Brussels, of the European division of Medtronic, a medical technology company.
The bride and bridegroom, who did not know each other at Middlebury, were introduced in 1996 by a mutual friend who was also a Middlebury graduate.
